descriptions.en:
<p><strong>Tiganesti Monastery</strong> lies between Bucharest and Ploiesti, <strong>near Ciolpani,</strong> surrounded by the lake named "lacul Maicilor", famous for it's beauty, it's weaving workshops where nuns create works of art. This is where the cloth for priests' clothes is woven and also where the embroided decorations of the moorish hall at <strong>Peles Castle</strong> was created.</p>
<p>The <strong>Tiganesti Monastery</strong> is first documented by a sale and donation act from july <em>1780</em> by <strong>Matei Tiganescu</strong> and his cousin <strong>Paraschiva Caplescu</strong> who build a small church here. The place is mentioned under the name <strong>Tiganesti</strong> in various government documents from <strong>Moruzi</strong> <em>1793</em>, <strong>Caragea</strong> <em>1813</em> and <strong>Dimitrie Ghica Voievod</strong> <em>1824.</em></p>
<p>Legend says that the monastery began in the time of <strong>Mihai Viteazul</strong> and <strong>lady Stanca</strong>, build by romanian monks from mount Athos, when the entire region was known as Vlasiei forests.</p>
<p>At first, a wooden church was build, where <strong>Clapescu family</strong> placed a marble slab on the altar with <em>1752</em> carved in it. Since <strong>Tiganescu</strong> donated the land, it came to be known as "<strong><span style="text-decoration: underline;">tiganesti</span></strong>".</p>
<p>The monastery was at first a small encampment with a wooden church and housing for the monks. From the original church only the icon of the <strong><em>Holy Mother holding baby Jesus</em></strong> remains, an icon known to perform miracles. At the time the monastery was populated by monks and was alloted to the Caldarusani monastery. After a short period of time, the monks are transferred to Caldarusani and they are replaced by nuns from the Schitul Turbati - Silistea Snagovului and Schitul Maicilor from Bucharest, documented in <em>june 5th 1805.</em></p>
<p>The wooden church is deemed too small and was demolished and in it's place a new church is build in <em>1812</em> which exists today, with the help of <strong>Radu Golescu</strong> and under Dosoftei as head of the monastery, from Caldarusani.</p>
<p>The building is constructed with specifics of those times, with a small tower above the entrance, decorated by tall windows.</p>
<p>The interior paintings were done in <em>1853</em> in neobizantin style by <strong>Eftimie</strong>. A long series of restorations took place in <em>1880, 1895, 1911</em> and in <em>1929</em> the entire church was repainted by <strong>Dimitrie Belizarie</strong>. The entrance still holds however several of the original paintings.</p>
<p>The exterior was redone in mozaic by <strong>Gheorghe Raducanu</strong> and paintings by <strong>Gheorghe Stoenescu</strong> in <em>1895</em> and restored by <strong>Gheorghe Samoila</strong> in <em>1989</em>.</p>
<p>Great care was taken during the restorations done between <em>1977</em> and <em>1986</em>, paintwork being assigned to painters <strong>Gheorghe Trasculescu</strong> and <strong>Valeria Musceleanu</strong>.</p>
<p>The two main buildings of the monastery having hallways supported by columns hold the nuns living quarters and a beautiful collection of art and books. They were build in <em>1920</em>, surrounding the church.<br /> The monastery itself is on a peninsula on unstable ground, and extensive consolidation work was done in the years <em>1980-1984</em>.</p>
<p>The small graveyard of the monastery has a tiny church of the Holy Trinity, build in <em>1817</em> and painted by <strong>Anton Serafin</strong>. THe building uses a post-brancovenesc style. Among the graves here, note the monument of the <strong>Diamandescu</strong> family carved by <strong>Carok Stork</strong> in <em>1889</em>.</p>
<p>Another remarcable building is the clock and bell tower, holding three large bells and a small one and the mechanical clock with two displays brought from Germany in <em>1911</em> and it's mechanism weighs over 1300kg.</p>
<p>The museum building exists since <em>1848</em>, at first an orphanage, then school and a museum since <em>1989</em>. Many icons on wood, cloth, glass and metal, old clothes, books and other religious artifacts.</p>
<p><em>Nearby are the workshops where the clothes for the clergy are woven. Here the nuns work using silk like threads made from plants and gold and silver threads. The machinery here are programmed by perforated cards.</em></p>
<p><strong>Paintings with vivid colors, the elegance of the buildings, the fame of it's workshops and the tranquility that can be found here are beloved to all the faithfull visitors and inhabitants alike.</strong></p>
<p><a href="http://www.crestinortodox.ro/biserici-si-manastiri-din-romania/67807-manastirea-tiganesti" target="_blank">Christian-Orthodox web portal - Manastirea Tiganesti</a> <code>(ro)</code></p>
<p><a href="http://www.ilfov.djc.ro/ObiectiveDetalii.aspx?ID=40&lacas=true" target="_blank">ILFOV county Department of Culture, Religion and National Treasure - Manastirea Tiganesti</a> <code>(ro)</code></p>

descriptions.ro:
Înconjurată de un curs de apă cunoscut sub numele Lacul Maicilor, Mănăstirea Ţigăneşti, aflată între Bucureşti şi Ploieşti, lângă comuna Ciolpani, este vestită atat prin frumuseţea sa, cât şi prin atelierele ei de ţesătorie, în care călugăriţele realizează adevărate opere de artă. Aici se ţese stofa pentru veşmintele preoţeşti şi tot aici a fost lucrată broderia pentru sala maură din Castelul Peleş.

Mănăstirea Ţigăneşti este atestată de documentul de donaţie şi vanzare-cumpărare din iulie 1780 al lui Matei Ţigănescu şi al verişoarei sale Paraschiva Caplescu, care construieşte o bisericuţă pe acest teren. Sub numele de Ţigăneşti o întalnim şi în hrisoavele domneşti de danii ale lui: Moruzi 1793, Caragea 1813 şi al lui Dimitrie Ghica Voievod din 1824.

Legenda susţinută de faptul că pomelnicul mănăstirii începe cu Mihai Viteazul şi Doamna Stanca, ne arată că aşezarea monahală exista încă de la începutul sec. XVII, fiind zidită de călugări români de la muntele Athos, când în aceste locuri erau codrii Vlăsiei.

La început aici a fost o biserică de lemn în care ctitorii, familia Caplescu, aşezaseră pe Altar o bucată de marmură pe care era inscripţonată data: 1752. Boierul Ţigănescu donase terenul şi de aici numele "ţigăneşti" dat locaşului respectiv.

A fost mai întâi Schit cu chilii şi biserică din lemn. Din această biserică din lemn s-a pastrat icoana făcătoare de minuni a Maicii Domnului cu Pruncul Iisus în braţe. Schitul Ţigăneşti, populat de călugări, trece sub oblăduirea Mănăstirii Căldăruşani, apoi la scurt timp călugării de aici sunt transferaţi la Căldăruşani, locul lor fiind luat de călugăriţele de la Schitul Turbaţi - Siliştea Snagovului şi Schitul Maicilor din Bucureşti - fapt atestat de hrisovul de la 5 iunie 1805.

Biserica de lemn devenită neîncăpătoare, a fost demolată şi pe locul ei a fost înălţată în 1812 actuala biserică cu hramul Adormirea Maicii Domnului, avându-l ctitor pe banul Radu Golescu, stareţ fiind Dosoftei.

Locaşul cu hramul Adormirea Maicii Domnului este construit în spiritul vremii, cu pridvor şi o singură turlă, decorată cu ferestre prelungi. Uşa de la intrarea în pronaos prezintă un ancadrament cu motive florale, admirabil executate.

Pictura interioară, executată în 1853, în stil neobizantin, a fost opera egumenului Eftimie. A urmat o serie de restaurări în 1880, 1895, 1911 iar în 1929 biserica a fost repictata de Dimitrie Belizarie. Pridvorul păsteaza însă câteva scene din pictura originală.

În exterior a fost refăcut mozaicul de către pictorul Gh. Răducanu iar catapeteasma pictată în 1895 de Gh. Stoenescu este refacută în 1989 de Gh. Samoilă.

Restaurările din 1977-1986 au fost făcute cu multă grijă, lucrările destinate picturii fiind încredintate pictorilor Gheorghe Trăsculescu şi Valeria Musceleanu, însoţiţi de un grup de ajutoare.

Cele două clădiri din incinta Mănăstirii, având cerdacuri susţinute de coloane, adăpostesc chiliile, stareţia, trapeza şi o minunată colecţie de arta bisericească şi carte veche. Construite în 1920, clădirile înconjoară biserica. Mănăstirea se află pe o peninsulă, terenul nefiind bine stabilizat, în anii 1980-1984 construcţia a fost consolidată.

Biserica de cimitir cu hramul Sf. Treime, de dimensiuni mai mici, a fost construită în 1817 şi pictată de Anton Serafin. Este o biserică de mici dimensiuni, frumos proporţionată, cu planul trilobat, cu pridvor deschis în stil post brâncovenesc. În cimitir se află monumente funerare vechi, din care menţionam monumentul familiei Diamandescu realizat de sculptorul Carol Stork în anul 1889.

Printre mândriile locaşului pot fi amintite clopotniţa cu trei clopote mari şi unul mic, şi mai ales ceasul mare, cu doua cadrane. Adus din Germania, în 1911, are un mecanism care cântăreşte mai mult de 1300 kg.

Clădirea muzeului, construită în 1848, a fost mai întâi orfelinat, apoi şcoală, arhondărie, iar din 1989 muzeu. Aici sunt expuse icoane pe lemn, pânză, sticlă şi metal, veşminte vechi, cărţi şi obiecte religioase.

Ansamblul mănăstirii mai cuprinde turnul clopotniţei, trapeza, casele monahale, cimitirul şi atelierele unde se ţes materiale pentru hainele preoţeşti. În acest atelier trudesc măicuţele mănăstirii, iar materialele folosite pentru hainele preoţeşti sunt din mătase vegetală şi cu fir de aur şi argint. Războaiele de ţesut sunt programate prin cartele perforate.

Prin pictura sugestivă, realizată în culori vii, prin eleganţa construcţiilor din jur, prin faima atelierelor şi linistea pe care o degajă, Mănăstirea Ţigăneşti rămâne un loc de reculegere, deosebit de îndrăgit de credincioşi.

Portalul Creştin Ortodox - Mănăstirea Ţigăneşti

Directia Judeţeană pentru Cultură, Culte şi Patrimoniul Cultural Naţional - ILFOV - Mănăstirea Ţigăneşti

descriptions.en:
<!-- === BEGIN short ================================================================ -->
<div style="background-color: #fffff0; padding: 2px;">
<h4>This multi-cache is a movie-quest.</h4>
<div>It's all about classics, movies you've all seen or at least have heard about! The places you'll discover aren't meant to be special. Try to look at them as symbols that should give you an idea of the movie titles you are looking for.</div>
<div align="right"><strong>Enjoy!</strong></div>
<p>Duration estimated at : 3-4 hrs.<br /><em>Public transport / taxi / private car recommended.</em></p>
</div>
<!-- === END short ================================================================== -->
<p><strong>[EN]</strong></p>
<div style="width: 640px; background-color: #f0f0f0; padding: 2px; margin-bottom: 1em; text-align: justify;"><strong>Remember:</strong><br /> The numbers you must find in order to calculate the coordinates are represented by CAPITAL LETTERS. Each letter can stand for one or more digits!<br /> <em>(for instance, Z can stand for 9 or 99)</em><br /> Brackets in the formulas are not to be multiplied! Multiplication is specifically designated by * if necessary.</div>
<!-- === STARTING POINT ============================================================= -->
<table style="width: 100%; border-bottom: 2px #666 solid; margin-bottom: 1em; border-spacing: 1px;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #e0e0e0; text-align: left; color: #900; padding: 3px; font-weight: bold;" colspan="2">STARTING POINT</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px;" colspan="2"><strong><code> N 44° 26.060 <br /> E 26° 04.175 </code></strong></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px; vertical-align: middle;">
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">You are now in front of a truly marvellous building. Asking the people inside an ordinary question will give you the title of the movie you are trying to figure out.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Released in 1972 by Warner Bros. and starring two famous actors, the film was a huge hit in theaters and is considered to be a screwball comedy.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Your task is to count the golden bunches of leaves forming a recurrent ornament on the fence <code><strong>(A)</strong></code> (consider only ONE ornament!) and the columns on the storefront of the building <code><strong>(B)</strong></code>.</p>
</td>
<td style="width: 150px; height: 150px; background-color: #f0f0f0; padding: 2px; vertical-align: middle;"><img src="http://www.opencaching.ro/images/uploads/F80EC955-42F7-2B42-1A4C-41572D7E8F01.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<!-- === STAGE1 ===================================================================== -->
<table style="width: 100%; border-bottom: 2px #666 solid; margin-bottom: 1em; border-spacing: 1px;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #e0e0e0; text-align: left; color: #900; padding: 3px; font-weight: bold;" colspan="2">STAGE1</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px;" colspan="2"><code> N 44° 26.(2*A+4)5 <br /> E 26° 05.(2*B)(B-1)(A-B) </code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 150px; height: 150px; background-color: #f0f0f0; padding: 2px; vertical-align: middle;"><img src="http://www.opencaching.ro/images/uploads/A15D01B9-99A7-2FE0-6005-2B66AB6D4D05.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></td>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px; vertical-align: middle;">
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">You are now standing in front of a famous, old store in Bucharest, already well-known in the communist times. Its name should give you a hint on the next movie-title. If you listen carefully, you will know what we mean.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">The film you are looking for (1965) starrs Christopher Plummer and was partly filmed in Salzburg, Austria and Bavaria, Germany.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Look up and count the number of floors over the store <code><strong>(C)</strong></code>. Count the number of horizontal masonry beams that unite the tall 2 story high columns inside the store(s) <code><strong>(D)</strong></code></p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<!-- === STAGE2 ===================================================================== -->
<table style="width: 100%; border-bottom: 2px #666 solid; margin-bottom: 1em; border-spacing: 1px;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #e0e0e0; text-align: left; color: #900; padding: 3px; font-weight: bold;" colspan="2">STAGE2</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px;" colspan="2"><code> N 44° 2(C+1).21*D <br /> E 26° 05.(C-3)9(C+2) </code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px; vertical-align: middle;">
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Although people are normally not permitted to go inside this area, you may notice surprisingly high traffic. Any wishes?</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">The movie you are searching for (1951) is an adaptation of a Pulitzer Prize-winning play of the same name. One of the leading roles is played by Marlon Brando.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">All around the main gate (which is green and most likely open - though you shouldn’t necessarily go through!), you will surely have noticed a traffic sign with a number on it <code><strong>(E)</strong></code>. On the left side of the gate there is a signboard with the name of the establishment. The pylon holding this board has stripes: <code><strong>(F)</strong></code> of them are red and <code><strong>(G)</strong></code> of them are white.</p>
</td>
<td style="width: 150px; height: 150px; background-color: #f0f0f0; padding: 2px; vertical-align: middle;"><img src="http://www.opencaching.ro/images/uploads/4D2E881D-4D73-15C0-DA19-11BAE2FC8AE3.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<!-- === STAGE3 ===================================================================== -->
<table style="width: 100%; border-bottom: 2px #666 solid; margin-bottom: 1em; border-spacing: 1px;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #e0e0e0; text-align: left; color: #900; padding: 3px; font-weight: bold;" colspan="2">STAGE3</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px;" colspan="2"><code> N 44° 26.(E*F*G+9)9 <br /> E 26° 05.9FG </code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="width: 150px; height: 150px; background-color: #f0f0f0; padding: 2px; vertical-align: middle;"><img src="http://www.opencaching.ro/images/uploads/61C1BE29-2D4A-4935-8C89-132D3C250536.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></td>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px; vertical-align: middle;">
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">You are now in front of a nice cafeteria. Let’s just hope you’ll start making new friends now!</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">This romantic film from 1942 is set during World War II. It was an immediate hit, and it has remained consistently popular ever since. Critics have praised the charismatic performances of the two leading actors.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Write down the street number <code><strong>(H)</strong></code> and then look inside the small courtyard of the café to count the old-fashioned lamps on the walls <code><strong>(I)</strong></code>. Don’t worry, even if the place should be closed, these are also to be easily spotted from outside.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody>
</table>
<!-- === STAGE4 ===================================================================== -->
<table style="width: 100%; border-bottom: 2px #666 solid; margin-bottom: 1em; border-spacing: 1px;">
<tbody>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #e0e0e0; text-align: left; color: #900; padding: 3px; font-weight: bold;" colspan="2">STAGE4</td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px;" colspan="2"><code> N 44° 26.(H+4)4 <br /> E 26° 05.(162*I) </code></td>
</tr>
<tr>
<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px; vertical-align: middle;">
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">This is one of Bucharest’s most famous clubs of its kind. Although the Romanian translation of the movie title you are trying to figure out is directly connected to the name of this place, foreigners won’t find it too hard to understand what it’s all about. Anyhow, it’s a matter of taste.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">This film from 1959 is considered to be one of the best American comedies of all times. It also starrs one of Hollywood’s famous beauties, who was pregnant during the film's production and had a miscarriage the day after its first audience preview.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Facing the club, turn around and count the small sqare-shaped windows on the right side of the opposite building <code><strong>(J)</strong></code>. You certainly won’t have any trouble identifying them, as they clearly form a rectangular pattern.</p>
</td>

</tr>

<td style="background-color: #f0f0f0; font-size: 85%; text-align: justify; padding: 3px; vertical-align: middle;">
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">No, your GPS didn’t lead you wrong! This public transport station is an important traffic junction, helping thousands of people reaching their daily destinations. After all, this is what progress is all about!</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Although not a "talkie", the film (1936) does include a synchronized sound track featuring music, singers, and voices coming from radios, loudspeakers etc. Towards the end of the film the famous’ Little Tramp's voice is heard for the first time.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Standing in front of the station, look inside and count the square-shaped fluorescent lamps on the ceiling <code><strong>(K)</strong></code>. Staying on the same side of the road as the station, cross the river. On this side of the bridge you see some pylons with old style lamps. How many lamps are there ? <code><strong>(L)</strong></code></p>

<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">Only one more stage to go before the last stop! This one is in front of a public institution. Aren’t you just crazy about this place?</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">This suspense movie was released in 1960. Although feature films were produced in color at the time, newsreels were shown in black and white. Filming the movie in black and white might have made it seem less gory, but it also might have seemed more real to viewers at the time who were used to seeing the news in black and white.</p>
<p style="margin-top: 0.5em; margin-bottom: 0.5em; text-indent: 2em;">On a green board on the left side of the entrance you will discover a seven-digit phone number. Divide the second last digit by the first one, and you will obtain <code><strong>(M)</strong></code>.</p>
</td>
<td style="width: 150px; height: 150px; padding: 0px; vertical-align: middle;"><img src="http://www.opencaching.ro/images/uploads/DB542B16-00D1-0C7D-4BA0-187B827331C3.jpg" alt="" width="150" height="150" /></td>

Anyway, write down each movie title. Take the longest word from each title and count the number of letters in it. You will get 7 numbers. <em>(take only the first word if more then one have same length)</em><br /> Calculate their sum <code><strong>(S)</strong></code>. <br /> Calculate their product and keep the first 3 digits <code><strong>(P)</strong></code>.</td>

descriptions.ro:
This multi-cache is a movie-quest.

It's all about classics, movies you've all seen or at least have heard about! The places you'll discover aren't meant to be special. Try to look at them as symbols that should give you an idea of the movie titles you are looking for.
Enjoy!
Duration estimated at : 3-4 hrs.

Public transport / taxi / private car recommended.

Remember:
The numbers you must find in order to calculate the coordinates are represented by CAPITAL LETTERS. Each letter can stand for one or more digits!
(for instance, Z can stand for 9 or 99)
Brackets in the formulas are not to be multiplied! Multiplication is specifically designated by * if necessary.
STARTING POINT
N 44° 26.060
E 26° 04.175

You are now in front of a truly marvellous building. Asking the people inside an ordinary question will give you the title of the movie you are trying to figure out.

Released in 1972 by Warner Bros. and starring two famous actors, the film was a huge hit in theaters and is considered to be a screwball comedy.

Your task is to count the golden bunches of leaves forming a recurrent ornament on the fence (A) (consider only ONE ornament!) and the columns on the storefront of the building (B).
STAGE1
N 44° 26.(2*A+4)5
E 26° 05.(2*B)(B-1)(A-B)

You are now standing in front of a famous, old store in Bucharest, already well-known in the communist times. Its name should give you a hint on the next movie-title. If you listen carefully, you will know what we mean.

The film you are looking for (1965) starrs Christopher Plummer and was partly filmed in Salzburg, Austria and Bavaria, Germany.

Look up and count the number of floors over the store (C). Count the number of horizontal masonry beams that unite the tall 2 story high columns inside the store(s) (D)
STAGE2
N 44° 2(C+1).21*D
E 26° 05.(C-3)9(C+2)

Although people are normally not permitted to go inside this area, you may notice surprisingly high traffic. Any wishes?

The movie you are searching for (1951) is an adaptation of a Pulitzer Prize-winning play of the same name. One of the leading roles is played by Marlon Brando.

All around the main gate (which is green and most likely open - though you shouldn’t necessarily go through!), you will surely have noticed a traffic sign with a number on it (E). On the left side of the gate there is a signboard with the name of the establishment. The pylon holding this board has stripes: (F) of them are red and (G) of them are white.
STAGE3
N 44° 26.(E*F*G+9)9
E 26° 05.9FG

You are now in front of a nice cafeteria. Let’s just hope you’ll start making new friends now!

This romantic film from 1942 is set during World War II. It was an immediate hit, and it has remained consistently popular ever since. Critics have praised the charismatic performances of the two leading actors.

Write down the street number (H) and then look inside the small courtyard of the café to count the old-fashioned lamps on the walls (I). Don’t worry, even if the place should be closed, these are also to be easily spotted from outside.
STAGE4
N 44° 26.(H+4)4
E 26° 05.(162*I)

This is one of Bucharest’s most famous clubs of its kind. Although the Romanian translation of the movie title you are trying to figure out is directly connected to the name of this place, foreigners won’t find it too hard to understand what it’s all about. Anyhow, it’s a matter of taste.

This film from 1959 is considered to be one of the best American comedies of all times. It also starrs one of Hollywood’s famous beauties, who was pregnant during the film's production and had a miscarriage the day after its first audience preview.

Facing the club, turn around and count the small sqare-shaped windows on the right side of the opposite building (J). You certainly won’t have any trouble identifying them, as they clearly form a rectangular pattern.
STAGE5
N 44° 25.0(J/2)
E 26° 06.(2*J+5)6

No, your GPS didn’t lead you wrong! This public transport station is an important traffic junction, helping thousands of people reaching their daily destinations. After all, this is what progress is all about!

Although not a "talkie", the film (1936) does include a synchronized sound track featuring music, singers, and voices coming from radios, loudspeakers etc. Towards the end of the film the famous’ Little Tramp's voice is heard for the first time.

Standing in front of the station, look inside and count the square-shaped fluorescent lamps on the ceiling (K). Staying on the same side of the road as the station, cross the river. On this side of the bridge you see some pylons with old style lamps. How many lamps are there ? (L)
STAGE6
N 44° 2(K-2).0(L+3)(L-2)
E 26° 07.(K-2)(K+1)3

Only one more stage to go before the last stop! This one is in front of a public institution. Aren’t you just crazy about this place?

This suspense movie was released in 1960. Although feature films were produced in color at the time, newsreels were shown in black and white. Filming the movie in black and white might have made it seem less gory, but it also might have seemed more real to viewers at the time who were used to seeing the news in black and white.

On a green board on the left side of the entrance you will discover a seven-digit phone number. Divide the second last digit by the first one, and you will obtain (M).
FINAL
All is well by now, but you do need to have a bit of knowledge about movies too.
You probably guessed some of them by now. Anyway, write down each movie title. Take the longest word from each title and count the number of letters in it. You will get 7 numbers. (take only the first word if more then one have same length)
Calculate their sum (S).
Calculate their product and keep the first 3 digits (P).
N 44° 2I.(I-L)(S/A)(J/C-F)
E 26° 0(K+M).(P+K*A+E*(F+C)*D)

The cache is smaller then micro at this time. Bring your own pen.
PLEASE BEWARE OF MUGGLERS!!!
DON'T LET YOURSELF GET SEEN WHEN YOU RETRIEVE THE CACHE!
IT’S A PRETTY CROWDED PLACE!!!
Have fun geocaching!

descriptions.en:
<p><span id="ctl00_ContentBody_LongDescription">A beautiful green oasis right in the center of the city of Cluj and a wonderful place for a walk in the park. (<a href="http://ro.wikipedia.org/wiki/Parcul_Central_din_Cluj-Napoca" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">visit link</a>)</span></p>
<p><span id="ctl00_ContentBody_LongDescription">I've chosen an easy to find place and a welcome stroll through the park and lake.</span></p>
<p><span id="ctl00_ContentBody_LongDescription">Look at the base of a bush, under dry twigs.<br /> Please cover the box well when you place it back.</span></p>
<p><span id="ctl00_ContentBody_LongDescription">Enjoy a walk in the grass :)</span></p>

descriptions.ro:
Oază de verdeaţă şi linişte în plin centrul oraşului, iată un loc minunat unde să ieşi la o plimbare în parc. (Parcul Central din Cluj)

Am ales aici încă un loc uşor de găsit pentru o plimbare prin parc şi lacul Chios.

Caută la baza unui tufiş, acoperit cu crenguţe uscate.
Acoperiţi bine cutia când o puneţi la loc.

Delectaţi-vă cu o plimbare pe iarbă :)
